Like many others, we found this place in a guide book.  My brother thought this was the best meal he had in Spain.  I also thought it was very delicious but we had so much good food in Spain that for me, it wasn't The Best overall.  We ate the following:1.  Eggplant and goat cheese terrine - this was delicious, my favorite dish here and one of my favorite dishes in Spain2.  Cod - this was okay.  It was a little too bland and fishy for me.3.  Sausage - this was good.  Tasty but I've had better sausage.  4.  Risotto with duck liver and mushrooms - this was delicious, very creamy.This place was full of American tourists who also probably found it in a guide book. :)The location was a bit hard to find.  It's near a church in one of the alleyways of the Barri Gotic area.  The interior is romantic and dark - which I loved (although I was with my family).  I also noticed that many of the customers were in dressier clothes than in other restaurants.  I was in my sightseeing clothes though (capris and tank top) and I did not feel out of place.I thought the prices were quite reasonable for what you get!  Our waitress was also nice and attentive.  I'd eat here again.
